alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 6:07PM MDT until July 26 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Sandoval and Santa Fe. In northeast New Mexico, San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, La Cienega, Cerrillos Hills State Park, Los Cerrillos, Lamy, Madrid, Canada De Los Alamos and Glorieta. - This includes the following low water crossings... General Goodwin Road and Ojo De La Vaca Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 283 and 290. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 257 and 273...and between Mile Markers 284 and 302. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
